messageBody:
Servus Nahan,

-----Original Message-----
From: Paris, Nathan x66165 [mailto:nathan_paris@...]
Sent: Friday, November 29, 2002 9:44 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] Order of execution


There is no guarantee that they will run in the order of the
test file and
you should not write your tests in a way that depends on this.
You should
use the setUp and tearDown methods to properly setup each test.


I know that this is the "pure doctrine". But what do you do, if you
have a series of dependent test (some interaction between two systems)
that need a defined protocoll and therefor a defined order?

You may say, these kind of tests ar no unit-tests, but in my experience,
you most of the time need many kind of tests within one application and
i like to make it comfortable and to have one TestSuite to control as
may tests as possible from one place.

Wolfgang
